intro: Cyrtochilum tucumanense, commonly known as the Tucumán orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to South America, particularly Argentina and Bolivia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, pseudobulbous structure and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow, typically blooming during the spring and early summer. Cyrtochilum tucumanense is adapted to grow in shaded, humid environments, often found in forest understories or rocky areas. Its unique morphology and ornamental flowers make it a prized species among orchid enthusiasts.
